subject: Chest pain
recommended_action: Call emergency services immediately; chew aspirin if advised by clinician
safe_action: Sit down, rest, avoid exertion

subject: Chest pain
safe_action: Rest and avoid exertion

subject: Left arm pain
safe_action: Keep person still and monitor breathing

subject: Left arm pain
safe_action: Sit down, stay calm

subject: Left arm pain
safe_action: Rest and avoid exertion

subject: Right arm pain
safe_action: Keep person still and monitor breathing

subject: Jaw pain
safe_action: Seek urgent help

subject: Jaw pain
safe_action: Rest and avoid exertion

subject: Shoulder pain
safe_action: Keep person still

subject: Back pain (upper)
safe_action: Keep person still

subject: Back pain (upper)
recommended_action: Call emergency services immediately; urgent surgical assessment
safe_action: Keep patient still and calm

subject: Cold sweats
safe_action: Keep person calm

subject: Nausea with chest pain
safe_action: Keep person still

subject: Lightheadedness with chest pain
safe_action: Lie down if dizzy; avoid sudden movements

subject: Palpitations
recommended_action: See primary care/ECG if recurrent or syncope
safe_action: Lie down if faint

subject: One-side weakness
recommended_action: Call emergency services immediately; note time of onset
safe_action: Do not give food or drink if swallowing difficulty

subject: Face drooping
safe_action: Keep person still; note time of onset

subject: Slurred speech
safe_action: Keep person comfortable

subject: Sudden vision loss
recommended_action: Seek emergency ophthalmic or stroke care immediately
safe_action: Avoid bright lights and note time of onset

subject: Sudden severe headache
safe_action: Keep person still; record time of onset

subject: Seizure lasting >5 minutes
safe_action: Protect from injury; do not force objects into mouth

subject: Shortness of breath
safe_action: Keep patient calm and still

subject: Shortness of breath
recommended_action: Use reliever inhaler and seek urgent review if not improving
safe_action: Sit upright and use prescribed inhaler

subject: Wheeze
safe_action: Use reliever inhaler if prescribed

subject: Productive cough with fever
recommended_action: See primary care for assessment; chest X-ray if indicated
safe_action: Hydrate and rest

subject: Cough >3 weeks
recommended_action: Arrange chest X-ray and TB testing as per local guidelines
safe_action: Isolate until evaluated if infectious risk

subject: Severe abdominal pain
safe_action: Avoid strong analgesics or food until evaluated

subject: Blood in stool
safe_action: Avoid NSAIDs until assessed

subject: Persistent vomiting
recommended_action: Hydration, ORS at home; seek care if cannot keep fluids
safe_action: Offer small sips of ORS if tolerated

subject: Persistent vomiting with bilious (green) vomit
safe_action: Do not give food or fluids until assessed

subject: Burning on urination
recommended_action: Urine test and treat if bacterial; seek primary care
safe_action: Hydration and analgesia

subject: Flank pain radiating to groin
safe_action: Hydration and seek ED if uncontrolled pain

subject: Blood in urine
recommended_action: Medical evaluation with urinalysis and imaging
safe_action: Do not ignore persistent haematuria

subject: High fever in infant <3 months
safe_action: Do not delay; keep infant warm and hydrated

subject: No tears when crying (infant)
recommended_action: Seek urgent medical attention; start ORS if advised
safe_action: Give small frequent sips of ORS; continue breastfeeding

subject: Bulging fontanelle
safe_action: Keep infant calm; seek urgent transport

subject: Severe abdominal pain in pregnancy
safe_action: Lie down and avoid exertion

subject: Heavy vaginal bleeding
safe_action: Lie down; apply pressure if external bleeding

subject: Reduced fetal movements after 28 weeks
recommended_action: Contact maternity unit urgently for fetal monitoring
safe_action: Lie on side and count movements

subject: Non-blanching rash / petechial rash
safe_action: Keep child still; avoid delay in transport

subject: Red swollen painful area of skin
recommended_action: Medical review and antibiotics if spreading
safe_action: Keep area elevated and clean

subject: Polyuria and polydipsia
recommended_action: Check blood glucose and see GP
safe_action: Hydration and medical review

subject: Severe drowsiness in diabetic
recommended_action: Go to ED for urgent metabolic management
safe_action: Do not give oral fluids if altered consciousness

subject: Severe sweating and tremor in diabetic
recommended_action: Give fast-acting carbohydrate if conscious; call emergency if not
safe_action: Give glucose gel/juice if conscious

subject: High fever with rash
safe_action: Keep patient warm and monitor breathing

subject: Fever with very low blood pressure and confusion
safe_action: Monitor breathing and consciousness; keep warm

subject: Suicidal thoughts
recommended_action: Contact emergency services or crisis line immediately
safe_action: Stay with person; remove access to means of harm

subject: Self-harm with severe injury
recommended_action: Attend ED and arrange psychiatric follow-up
safe_action: Ensure immediate safety and wound care

subject: Sudden hearing loss
recommended_action: Seek urgent ENT or audiology assessment
safe_action: Avoid loud noise exposure

subject: Drooling/refusal to swallow
safe_action: Keep child seated and do not force oral intake

subject: Sudden painless vision loss
recommended_action: Seek emergency ophthalmology or stroke care immediately
safe_action: Avoid bright lights; note time of onset

subject: Eye chemical splash
recommended_action: Irrigate eye with clean water for 15+ minutes and seek urgent ophthalmic care
safe_action: Flush eye continuously; do not rub

subject: Major trauma with deformity
recommended_action: Call emergency services and immobilize limb
safe_action: Apply pressure to bleeding; avoid moving until stabilized

subject: Large-area burns
recommended_action: Call emergency services and arrange burn centre care
safe_action: Cool burn with running water for 20 minutes

subject: Post-coital bleeding
recommended_action: Arrange urgent gynaecology or colposcopy referral
safe_action: Avoid sexual activity until assessed

subject: Vaginal discharge with fishy odour
recommended_action: See GP or sexual health clinic for testing and treatment
safe_action: Avoid douching and scented products

subject: Unexplained weight loss
recommended_action: Refer for urgent investigation per local guidelines
safe_action: Document weight and symptoms

subject: Rash with target lesion
recommended_action: Seek urgent assessment if mucosal involvement
safe_action: Stop suspected offending drug and seek care

subject: Rash that itches and spreads
recommended_action: Identify and avoid the trigger; topical emollients
safe_action: Avoid further exposure to allergen

subject: Sudden unilateral leg swelling and pain
safe_action: Limit walking and seek review

subject: New painful non-healing ulcer
recommended_action: Specialist wound care and debridement; assess for osteomyelitis
safe_action: Offload pressure and keep clean
